Bio:
Erin Cantrell is a Senior from Smithville, Tennessee studying Environmental Science and Sustainability with a concentration in Land, Air, and Water Resources.

This spring and summer she was studying in Copenhagen, Denmark.

For the past two years she has been working under Cornell's Biological and Environmental Engineering Department in the Soil and Water Lab doing research on salinity concentrations of runoff water from campus.

Other than Theta Tau she is involved in teaching classes with Cornell Outdoor Education, volunteering in a mentorship program, and helping her social sorority. Outside of her campus activities she enjoys hiking, rock climbing, caving, reading, and traveling.

Nikita Gupta is a senior from Princeton, NJ studying Computer Science with a minor in business.

This past summer, Nikita interned at Apple Inc. In the past, she has interned with Bank of America Merrill Lynch, and with Martha Stewart. She has also studied abroad at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology in Hong Kong. On campus, in addition to Theta Tau, Nikita is involved with Spoon University, WICC (Women in Computing at Cornell), Girls Who Code, and Palante Salsa.

Her interests include cooking (check her out at www.nikitaskitchen.com), scuba diving, salsa dancing, sailing, and running.
Cornell Rugby President, Concrete Canoe Sub-team Lead, Interned at Archway Analytics

Irene Li is a senior from Chicago, IL majoring in Civil Engineering with a focus in civil infrastructure.

Most recently, she interned at Simpson, Gumpertz & Heger in the Structures Division working on structural investigations predicting the service life of historical structures. Prior to that, she interned in the Buildings Division of The Walsh Group providing pre-construction services and value engineering on new construction projects.

On campus, Irene is a member of Chi Epsilon and the former Team Leader of the Steel Bridge project team. Outside of academics, Irene enjoys cooking, reading, photography, and volleyball.

Sahitya Mantravadi is a senior from Fremont, CA majoring in Computer Science and minoring in Applied Mathematics and in Business.

Last summer, she interned at Goldman Sachs as a Securities Strats Summer Analyst. On campus, she is a Teaching Assistant for CS 4780. She also does research with the Cornell Center for Space Research and Radiophysics on star formation and dust gathering around the supermassive black hole at the center of the Milky Way Galaxy.

In her free time, Sahitya enjoys playing guitar, reading, cooking plant-based foods, and yoga.

Anastasia (Anya) Varanko is a senior from Woodbury, CT studying Biological Engineering with a minor in Biomedical Engineering.

Anya is currently a researcher in Dr. Minglin Ma’s lab. Her project focuses on electrospray applications and the development of novel co-culture systems. Last summer, she held a research internship at Duke University, where she studied the use of biopolymers for colon cancer therapeutics. Anya has previously been a member of Dr. Xiling Shen’s Lab, where she studied cell signaling mechanisms and protein upregulation in colon cancer metastasis.

Outside of research, Anya is the president of Alpha Epsilon, the Biological Engineering Honor Society. She is a TA for BEE 3400 (Design and Analysis of Biomaterials), and has also TA’d BEE 3310 and BEE 2600. She is also an Irwin and Joan Jacobs Engineering Scholar. Previously, Anya has served as Recruitment Chair and Alumni Relations Chair of Theta Tau, as well as Campus Ministry Chair at St. Luke Lutheran Church in Collegetown.

Pavan is a senior studying Operations Research & Engineering and is from St. Louis, MO.

In the past he has interned at an architectural firm in Operations, BNY Mellon as a Business Analyst, worked at the Dyson School for the Business Minor Program, and spent the past summer as a Consulting Intern at Oliver Wyman. He is interested in management consulting and the application of Operations Research to the broader business world.

In his free time, he enjoys cooking, reading, singing with his a capella group, and spending time with his friends.
andjosaquino.github.io

Katie is a senior studying Chemical Engineering. This summer she worked as a GSTC intern at Merck as part of the Global Vaccines Biologics and Commercialization group. As part of the group, she used small scale bioreactors to produce monoclonal antibodies. The summer before she did similar work at AbbVie.

On campus, Katie is a member of the Fluoride subteam on AguaClara. She is also one of Theta Tau's social chairs and a member of the recruitment committee of her sorority. She is also co-president of Mixed at Cornell, as well as a member of Engineering Ambassadors.

In her free time Katie enjoys practicing yoga, reading and spending time with friends.

Gaia is a senior currently studying Operations Research. Last summer, Gaia worked at BNP Paribas where she will be returning full time. On campus Gaia is involved in a social sorority, the Cornell French Society, was a founder of the mentorship group BEARS, organized this year's 3 Day Startup event and works part time at the Johnson Business School. In her free time Gaia likes to cook, ski, sail and meet new (preferably interesting) people!

TJ is a Pre-Law Senior in the College of Engineering studying Information Science, Systems, & Technology.

This past summer TJ worked on various legal technology projects at CodeX, a center for legal informatics in Stanford, as a 2016 Kessler Fellow. In the past, he has also worked as a full-stack developer at KnowledgeTown. Next year he will be working full-time as a Software Application Engineer at Workday in Pleasanton, CA.

On campus, TJ is Co-President of BASE Productions, Consultant for CS 1112, and a member of the Cornell Filipino Association.

Yezy is a senior studying ISST with a minor in business.

On campus, she is a mentor for Engineers Without Borders and a TA for INFO 4120.

This past summer, Yezy was a product management intern at athenahealth, a healthcare technology company located near Boston. Two summers ago, she worked on data analysis for the Firmwide Compensations team at Goldman Sachs. For full time, she will be joining APT as a product manager. During her free time, Yezy likes to write on her secret blog, read, eat yummy things, and watch fun Youtube videos!

John is a Senior studying Materials Science and Engineering. In the past he has interned at Corning Inc and Pratt and Whitney. On campus he is a subteam lead on Design Build Fly and on the executive board of the Cornell Materials Society.

Hannah Rudin is a senior studying Mechanical Engineering and a member of the 2016 Kessler Fellowship Cohort. In her free time she works four different jobs for Cornell Outdoor Education, plays competitive Ultimate Frisbee with the Cornell Roses, and cooks. New this year, she's decided to add on a couple of fun side projects with Rev:Ithaca Startup Works.

She just finished up a summer placement at Rev:Ithaca Startup Works through the Kessler Fellowship program, where she wore a variety of hats under the title of Instructor for the Summer Hardware Accelerator program.

Arpit is a senior studying Computer Science. His professional interests are a combination of technology, entrepreneurship, and design. As a 2016 Kessler Fellow last summer, Arpit worked for Matter, an early-stage NYC startup committed to revitalizing American manufacturing. In the past, Arpit has done entrepreneurship consulting at a startup incubator by Life Changing Labs and software development at Verizon Wireless. He plans on pursuing an MEng in CS next year.

On campus, Arpit is a TA for Data Driven Web Apps (INFO / CS 3300). He is the former Regent of Theta Tau and Business Lead for the Cornell Mars Rover project team. Arpit enjoys spending his personal time designing, reading, and adventuring with his camera.

Emma is a senior studying Operations Research Engineering and minoring in Applied Economics and Management.

Her professional interests are a combination of entrepreneurship, technology and business. Last summer, Emma interned at J.P. Morgan in Business Intelligence and Equity Derivative Sales, and she will be returning full time in CMBS Capital Markets. In the past, she has also worked as a developer and technology analyst intern at Mindshare, building out quality assurance tools and reports for the company.

On campus, Emma works in the Social Dynamics Laboratory using data collected from social media (i.e. Twitter API) to analyze social trends. She has also done research in the Cornell Laboratory of Plasma Studies and attended the ICOPS (International Conference on Plasma Studies) in June 2014 to present findings on magnetic field creation. Emma is also a member of Alpha Phi, a social sorority.

Adam Berry is a chemical engineering major with a minor in business graduating in 2018. His professional interests are alternative energy development and process engineering.

On campus, he is the AIChE Professional Development director and is involved in the CUROSE saxophone quartet. Last semester, he served as the Theta Tau Academics Chair. He also performs research in the Joo lab synthesizing Si-based nanofibers towards a better Li-ion battery.

This past summer, he worked in Germany at the University of Ulm researching better magnesium battery electrolytes. The previous summer, he worked at the International Institute of Nanotechnology researching feasible permanent magnet alternatives. Before that, he worked at EDAX Inc. (a materials analysis company) and Sun Chemical Inc. (an ink manufacturing company). When not working, he loves to hike around campus.

Max is a senior majoring in Environmental Engineering from Lynbrook, New York. He has worked as an Environmental Engineering Intern for MTA New York City Transit. On campus he is a TA, conducts research, and is the current Director of Public Relations for Engineers for Engineers for a Sustainable World (ESW).

Brittney is a senior from the San Francisco Bay Area studying Mechanical Engineering.

Last summer she worked at Seagate Technology as a Manufacturing Engineering Intern and focused on process optimization and efficiency. Prior to that, she was a Team Leader at Galileo Innovation Summer Camps for two summers. On campus, she is now a retired senior, previously serving as the Vice Regent of Theta Tau and Photography Editor at The Cornell Daily Sun.

In her free time she enjoys keeping up with the Kardashians, following the current season of the Bachelor, and watching her favorite Youtube vloggers.

Richa is currently a Junior studying Computer Science with a minor in Information Science from New Jersey.

On campus, she is involved in a range of organizations that align with her passions. She is a member of WICC (Women in Computing at Cornell) as the Publicity Director, a consultant for CS 3110, and a member of Kappa Kappa Gamma.

Her professional interests include combining her passion for software with helping people around her. This past summer she was a software engineering intern at American Express and worked on a big data team. In her free time she enjoys shopping, learning new things, and helping others.

Daria is a junior currently pursuing a bachelor's degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering. Daria is interested in working in the defense industry after graduating with a focus on cyber security.

On campus she is actively involved in her professional engineering fraternity Theta Tau, is a member of Cornell's Boxing Club, Society of Women Engineers, Women in Computing at Cornell, as well as The Society for Women in Business. She also works as an administrative assistant at the McGovern Center which is an incubator for life science companies on Cornell's campus.

When she is not coding microcontrollers, Daria can be found at CrossFit Pallas making gainz with her badass CrossFit squad. When asked what she does for cardio her response is lift weights faster, and, of course, walk up the slope every morning to get to class. Her favorite things include CrossFit, coffee, CrossFit, chocolate, and in case you didn't get it yet, CrossFit.

Richard Goodwyn, known to his friends as Blake, is a senior studying Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering from Rumson, NJ.

This past summer, Blake took part in Cornell's Kessler Fellows Program and worked with OpenROV, a telerobotics startup based in Berkeley, CA. There, he designed a system for testing the depth capability of underwater robots and developed a go-to-market strategy for the startup's product launch later this year.

On campus, Richard works with CUAir, Cornell's Unmanned Aerial Systems project team, to develop autonomous flight systems as well as instructs rock climbing programs through Cornell Outdoor Education. In his spare time, he enjoys a variety of activities, such as camping in the Adirondacks, playing various stringed instruments, reading about marine ecology, Tetris, and watching old films.

Martín is currently a senior studying mechanical engineering and is from Orlando, FL.

On campus he is a team lead of Design, Build, Fly and a 2016 Kessler Fellow. He spent last summer interning at Shaper Tools in San Francisco working on design and test engineering. The previous summer he worked at Lockheed Martin in supply chain. In his spare time he enjoys film, sketching, cooking, board games, working on personal projects, and picking up new skills.

Addison is a sophomore from Charlotte, North Carolina studying Materials Science and Engineering and minoring in Business.

On campus, she is a tour guide, a member of Pi Beta Phi sorority, and she co-hosts a podcast for the Cornell Daily Sun. She works for Cornell University Sustainable Design, a design-build project team focused on social, ecological, and economic sustainability, as well as the branch of Engineers for a Sustainable world focused on biofuels initiatives.

Last summer, she was a Hardware Engineering / Business Analyst Intern at Entrepreneurs Roundtable Accelerator.

A senior mechanical engineer/NBA all star, Deepthi spent her last summer away from the courts and in Pittsburgh at Uber ATC as a hardware intern working on design and testing. In the past, she has also worked at Federal Mogul, a back end automotive company in Plymouth, Michigan as well as at StreetView in Google's Mountain View campus. This upcoming summer, she is very excited to be joining Google X's Self Driving Team. During the school year, Deepthi is one of the three team leads for Cornell's Baja Racing team and enjoys making frequent trips to the dairy bar.

Taylor is a senior from Newton, MA, majoring in Computer Science.

This past summer he interned at Amazon, working with the Content Access Authority team of Amazon Instant Video, in Seattle. On campus he is a course consultant for CS 3110 and is involved with his social fraternity.

In his free time, Taylor enjoys trail running and bothering Arpit about money as the Theta Tau treasurer.

Wey-Wey is a senior studying Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering from Wilmington, North Carolina.

The past few summers, he has working in the Kirby Microfluidics Laboratory studying rare cell capture, with possible applications for better cancer treatment, and algae lipid biofuels extraction. He has secured 2nd author on a submitted publication to the scientific journal Biomicrofluidics, and hopes to follow up with another paper throughout his last year.

On campus, Wey-Wey has been involved in the Cornell Santos Men's Club Soccer Team, the Cornell Symphony Orchestra, the leadership board of Engineering Ambassadors, and Pre-Orientation Service Trips (POST) as a leader. He has also served as a teaching assistant for ENGRD2020 Statics.

Amy is a senior (old man) studying Computer Science from Canada.

As a 2016 Kessler Fellow, she discovered that the world of tech startups has an unlimited supply of Hershey chocolates and starbursts.

Hobbies aside from eating chocolate and candy include playing Neopets and Pokemon, and following the Financial Times on world markets.

Nicholas is a junior from Warren, NJ, studying Operations Research and Engineering with a minor in Business.

This past summer, Nicholas was a supply chain intern at ExxonMobil working on improving demand forecasting. The summer before he worked at Optimization Direct working on markdown optimization and consumer behavior. On campus, Nicholas serves as a Leader of Cornell's Autonomous Underwater Vehicle Business/PR subteam and has served as Professional Development Chair of Theta Tau. He is also involved in Cornell's International Affairs Society. In his free time, Nicholas likes to play soccer, ski, keep up on the news, and watch comedy shows.

Marco Bustamante is a junior from Thessaloniki, Greece studying Mechanical Engineering. In the future he dreams of working in product design and manufacturing. On campus, Marco is a 2017 Kessler Fellow and a member of the Varsity Lightweight Rowing team.

The summer after his freshman year, he represented the United States at the Under-23 World Rowing Championships. This past summer, he spent half his time rowing for Cornell at Henley Royal Regatta in the UK, and the other half interning with Urnex Brands as a Production Engineer in their factory.

When Marco is not studying or at the boathouse, he can usually be found either spending quality time watching movies or working out.

Andrea is a junior from Woodbury, MN studying Biological Engineering with a minor in Biomedical Engineering while following the premed track.

Last summer, Andrea worked in the King Lab on campus while taking classes. Her project for the King Lab studies mechanisms of cancer metastasis, focusing on how cancer associated fiber blasts and circulating tumor cells interact in the blood stream. Her team hopes to use their findings to inhibit metastasis, the leading cause of cancer deaths.

Outside of Theta Tau, she enjoys exploring new places, attempting to cook, and making horrible puns.

Jeannie Fu is a senior from Boulder, Colorado majoring in Computer Science and minoring in Mechanical Engineering.

She previously interned at Intel in hardware validation, and most recently was an iOS software engineering intern at LinkedIn on the Who’s Viewed My Profile team. She will be joining Google full time in the fall.

On campus, she has been a TA for CS 1112 for three years. She is also currently one of the Professional Development chairs for Theta Tau.

Saie is a junior majoring in Biological Engineering and planning on minoring in Biomedical Engineering. In the past, she served as the Cornell iGEM team lead and currently serves as the team's alumni chair. She works on North Campus as an RA, is part of the Hindu Student Council, and works in the Putnam Lab. A recent graduate of the Cornell Engineering Leadership Program, Saie will be a TA for the program this year.

As she enjoys both innovation and research, Saie hopes to pursue a career in the intersection of business and engineering research. She will be interning at P&G next summer and is excited to explore Cincinnati. Outside of school and work, Saie loves to travel, knit, and pet cute animals.

Devon is a senior from Rochester, NY majoring in Civil Engineering and pursuing minors in Business Administration and Engineering Management.

Last summer, Devon interned for The Whiting Turner Contracting Co as a project engineer on the Cornell Veterinary Medicine project. He will be in Washington, D.C. next summer interning with the Clark Construction Group. In the past Devon has participated in the Rochester chapter of the ACE Mentor program in association with PIKE Construction and Labella Associates. This program educates students on the fields of Architecture, Construction and Engineering and exposes them to everything from residential design to land surveying.

Apart from his studies, he is a member of the social fraternity Pi Kappa Alpha, a member of the American Society of Civil Engineers, and is very involved in volunteer service ranging from volunteer soccer coaching to drug and alcohol abuse counseling.

Outside of the classroom you can find him staying active, socializing with friends and likely searching for the next great restaurant.

Junie is a junior studying Operations Research and Information Engineering with a minor in Business.

Last summer, she was interning at the Federal Communications Commission in their Media Bureau Engineering Division. Previously, she has also worked at the National Institutes of Health.

On campus, Junie is a Commissioner for the Student Assembly Funding Commission, which is responsible for the funding of almost all Cornell student organizations. She is also the Fall Recruitment Chair.

Megan is a junior from Princeton, New Jersey studying Mechanical Engineering. Last summer she worked for the Engineering Admissions office and held a research position in the Shepherd Lab. She is currently interested in both the automotive and aerospace industries. On campus she is a member of the Intel Cornell Cup project team. She is also a part of the Panhellenic community, the Society of Women Engineers, and Engineering Ambassadors. In her spare time she enjoys watching low quality foreign TV shows, eating unhealthy snacks, and reading.

Ryan is a senior Information Science major from New York, NY. He joined Theta Tau in last Fall and on campus has also been involved in Student Agencies, the Cornellian Yearbook, Cornell Strategic Consulting, and his social fraternity. Last summer he was an investment banking summer analyst in the Mergers and Acquisitions group at RBC Capital Markets. Ryan enjoys sitcom television and italian food.

Kevin Schaich is a senior at Cornell University from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania studying Computer Science. Beginning August 2017, he will be working as a Forward Deployed Engineer for Palantir Technologies. Previously, he interned as a Software Engineer at Workday, a software company specializing in HR, and shopkick, an e-commerce startup in Silicon Valley, CA.

Kevin is passionate about photography and hopes to travel around the world the summer after he graduates. He serves as the current President for Cornell Photo Society, Cornell's foremost organization dedicated to photography, and previously served as the Marketing Chair for the Kappa Delta chapter of Theta Tau. On the side he golfs, skis, plays three instruments and does free-lance graphic design/web development.

See his work at http://schaich.io

Amelia is a junior from Great Falls, Virginia studying Chemical Engineering, hoping to minor in Southeast Asian Studies.

She spent the last summer as a research assistant for the Netravali Group in the school of Fiber Science, tour guide for the College of Engineering, and Stand Up Paddle Board Instructor. Having worked on projects concerning hydrophobic denim and biodegradable composites, she hopes to work in consumer products, specifically with bioplastics and other means of sustainable packaging. Elsewhere on campus, she is heavily involved in Cornell Outdoor Education as a Rock Climbing Instructor and Outdoor Odyssey Guide, Cornell's FM radio station WVBR 93.5 as a Radio Show Host and Promotions Team member, and her social sorority.

Outside of school you can catch her cooking with friends, climbing at the wall, or attempting to learn Spanish on Rosetta Stone.

Sean is a Junior from Iselin NJ, majoring in Computer Science.

Over the past year and a half, he has worked at a startup, Wellth working on combating insurance fraud and improving patient adherence. As an iOS developer he developed a uber-ish app to connect home aid nurses to elderly patient while providing real time tracking and monitoring to prevent fraud. As a web developer he worked on creating a dynamic dashboard to monitor and manage chronic disease patients.

On campus, Sean is the Cornell Mars Rover Business Team lead and Cornell Piano Society. In his free time he enjoys gymnastics, lifting and watching basketball.

Luke is a Junior from Philadelphia, PA majoring in Operations Research and Information Engineering and minoring in Business. Luke is a member of Theta Tau's most distinguished pledge class, the Kappas. He spent last summer in Ithaca working for Student Agencies, Inc. managing Big Red Shipping & Storage. This year, Luke will be President of Student Agencies, Inc. overseeing all operations and strategy for the umbrella businesses. On campus, Luke also serves as President of his social fraternity, Sigma Chi.

Erin is a junior studying Computer Science from Lexington, MA.

Last summer, she was a software engineering intern at Akamai Technologies in Boston, where she built a web application to view anomalous activity across Akamai's platform network. Prior to that, she helped develop a brain visualization tool as an undergraduate researcher at Purdue.

On campus, she is a member of Cornell Engineering World Health, a project team that creates engineering solutions for global health problems. In the future, she hopes to combine her interests in computer science and health technology.

Outside of school, she is passionate about making (and eating) food, biking, reading, and photography.

Lindsey is a sophomore from Wayne, NJ studying Mechanical Engineering with an interest in the Aerospace and Automotive Industry.

On campus she is a suspension sub-team member of the Cornell FSAE Racing Project Team, a defensive player for the Lady Bears Club Volleyball team, and currently serving as the Recruitment Chair for Theta Tau this semester.

This past summer she built a model airplane in her free time and also was an Orientation Leader to incoming freshmen. This upcoming summer Lindsey will be a Project Engineer Intern at Phillips 66 in Linden, NJ.

When she's not working in Duffield you can find her playing volleyball, crafting, discovering new foods, chasing dogs around campus, or beating Francis at Catan.

Andrei is a junior from Somers, NY studying Engineering Physics with interests in quantum information processing, photonics, and aerospace engineering. He hopes to pursue a PhD in electrical engineering and a career in research and development in industry.

He has been a part of the Vengalattore experimental cold atom group in the Laboratory of Atomic and Solid State Physics since his sophomore year and worked there this past summer. His research focuses on the fabrication of optical nano-fibers used to characterize micro-resonators. Such devices are used in hybrid quantum systems to research ultra-sensitive measurement techniques. In the past Andrei has worked in a photonics research group in University of California San Diego and was a member of the Violet Satellite project team.

On campus, Andrei is a beatboxer for the Red Solo acapella group and is the co-Treasurer for the service learning organization Bridges to Community. He is also a Mountain Biking instructor for Cornell Outdoor Education and has worked as a teaching assistant for PHYS 2213: Electricity and Magnetism.

Eric is a junior studying Electrical and Computer Engineering, with a minor in Computer Science.

Last summer Eric worked for SRC, Inc. developing a web application for use in electronic warfare. He previously interned at StartFast Venture Accelerator, doing mobile development for multiple startups in the program.

On campus, he is an app developer for Belle Apps and is actively involved in his social fraternity.. Additionally, Eric is the current Treasurer of Theta Tau. Next summer, Eric will be interning with Blackstone.

Katrina is a junior from Bellport, NY studying Mechanical Engineering with a focus in Biomedical Engineering. Along with being the Vice Regent of Theta Tau, Katrina is also the President of the Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers on campus.

This past summer Katrina stayed in Ithaca to conduct research in Dr. Singh's Lab to learn how the immune system reacts in people with Chron's Disease and cancer. This upcoming summer Katrina will be working as a mechanical engineering intern at BAE Systems in San Jose, California.

In the future Katrina hopes to work in the biomedical industry handling medical devices or prosthetics. In her spare time she likes to run around Ithaca, play soccer, and laugh at her own jokes.

Anna Lawrence is a sophomore from Long Island, NY, in the College of Agriculture and Life Sciences. She is majoring in Environmental Engineering with interest in Energy and Architecture.

Over the summer, Anna interned for Vidaris, an Environmental and Structural Engineering firm in New York City. She worked closely with the Energy and Green Teams and learned how to implement concepts regarding Energy Use, Renewables and Lighting. Anna also spent her spring break working on Environmental projects in Israel.

Aside from school, she enjoys playing soccer, hanging with her friends, and napping.

Cody is a Junior studying Computer Science with minors in Electrical and Computer Engineering and Business.

This past summer, he interned at Medidata Solutions in New York City as a Software Development Engineer. He has also interned at IBM.

On campus, Cddy is currently the Webmaster of Theta Tau and has been a member of the Intel-Cornell Cup project team and is involved in club soccer/track and CSA.

When he has free time, he likes to go on spontaneous adventures and take risks.

Hiking-Photography-Piano-Music

Charlene is a junior from Maple Grove, MN studying Operations Research and minoring in Applied Math. She is currently the Marketing Chair for Theta Tau.

Professionally, Charlene is interested in data analytics and machine learning.

Previously, she interned at Bank of New York Mellon (BNY Mellon) as a technology analyst in the Asset Liability Management department and BOPU Fund in Hong Kong as a strategy analyst.

Aside from Theta Tau, Charlene is the Art Director of The Thread Magazine, captain of Women's Club Volleyball, and member of Kappa Delta Sorority.

In her free time, Charlene is passionate about fashion, graphic design, volleyball, and finding new music.

Pehuen is a junior studying Computer science with interest in robotics and computer vision. He hopes to pursue a career in robotics research and development. Last summer, he worked in the robotics lab here at Cornell developing software and hardware for socially assistive robots. In the past he was worked on websites and applications for startups and small businesses. He is also a new member of the Cornell Autonomous Bicycle team.

Outside of academics Pehuen is a kayaking instructor for Cornell Outdoor Education and a member of Cornell Mundial F.C. In his free time he enjoys whitewater kayaking, experimenting in the kitchen, and hammocking.

Jad is a junior from Beirut, Lebanon studying Computer Science with a minor in Business. His professional interests lie in the intersection of Business, Technology, and User Experience.

Last summer he interned as a Product Manager at Graphiq, a tech startup in Santa Barbara, CA . This summer he will be working at Google as an Associate Product Manager Intern.

Jad has also had several entrepreneurial experiences, including founding Carshare, an Uber-inspired startup in Lebanon that aims to disrupt the transportation industry there and compete with the biggest Lebanese taxi companies.

Erica Sadler is a junior from Laurel, MD studying Biomedical Engineering.

This past summer, Erica worked as an undergraduate researcher for the National Institute of Arthritis, Musculoskeletal, and Skin Diseases. There she was involved in a project using CRISPR/Cas9 technology to knock out the genes associated with the Mediator complex. Erica has done previous research at the Johns Hopkins Proteomics Laboratory and the University of Pennsylvania's GRASP Laboratory.

On campus, Erica is an undergraduate researcher in the Adie Lab, which focuses on biomedical imaging, and is a member of Alpha Xi Delta. In her free time, she enjoys hanging out with friends, staying active, watching trashy TV, and drinking too much coffee.

Annie is a sophomore AEP major from Charlottesville, Virginia. On campus, she is a member of the varsity cross country and track teams and an undergraduate researcher in the Lambert Lab for Quantitative Single-Cell Biophysics. The past two summers, Annie has interned at Orbital ATK and Analytical Mechanics Associates.

Joe Wetzel is a sophomore in the College of Engineering, majoring in Civil Engineering and minoring in Business. On campus, he is a member of the Cornell Steel Bridge project team, and involved as an Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in the Physics department.

Over the past few years, Joe has worked as a District Office intern for U.S. Congressman Steve Israel, and been involved with environmental engineering research at Hofstra University. This past summer he continued studying at Cornell.

Joe is from Northport, New York, and in his free time he enjoys running, watching movies, and supporting FC Bayern Munich.

Joseph Adas is a sophomore Mechanical Engineering major from Amman, Jordan. On campus, he works at the Emerson Machine Shop and is a member of Cornell Baja Racing. Professionally, he hopes to be involved in manufacturing and product design.

This past summer he focused his efforts on a personal engineering project centered around one of his hobbies and plans to be interning at Sensata Technologies this coming summer as a Mechanical Engineering Intern.

In his free time outside of Autolab and the shop, Joe is usually working on personal projects and spending time with the college fam

Kat Bau is a sophomore from Queens, New York studying Computer Science in the College of Engineering, hoping to minor in Feminist Gender and Sexuality Studies.

On campus, Kat is involved in CUAir as their resident marketing lead, Camp Kesem as Volunteer Coordinator, where she trains the 2017 counselors to prepare them to spread Kesem magic. She is also Theta Tau's current marketing chair.

When she isn't working, Kat loves spoken word poetry and cackling away with Jinghan in Duffield.

Giacomo Di Liberto is a sophomore from Northport, New York, studying Electrical and Computer Engineering and minoring in Business. On campus, he is the treasurer of the Cornell Mock Trial Association and is also an Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in the Physics department.

He likes too talk to much and when he does, he often overuses hand gestures. Giacomo likes to play soccer, immerse himself in other cultures, and enjoy the finer things in life: like Netflix and Benjamin Gassaway. Giacomo is interested in attending law school after graduating from Cornell in order to practice intellectual property law.

Ben Gassaway is a Junior from Lumberton, NJ studying environmental engineering. His career interests in engineering include alternative energy and sustainability. Ben hopes to pursue a career as an environmental attorney later in his career. On campus, Ben is a member of Lightweight Rowing and works for the College of Engineering Alumni Relations.

The summer following freshman year, Ben interned at Monmouth Physics Associates working with medical devices and radiopharmaceuticals. The summer after his sophomore year, he worked for Bristol-Myers Squibb in the Global Energy Services division.

When Ben isn't worried about his future, you can find him at the beach skimboarding with friends, or on Spotify looking for fresh tunes.

Kara Guse is a sophomore from Bay Area, CA majoring in Materials Science & Engineering and minoring in International Relations.

On campus she has been on the Structures subteam of the project team Design/Build/Fly since freshman year. She is also working under the Schlom Group researching oxide molecular-beam epitaxy. Other than that, she is involved with her social sorority, Alpha Phi.

In her free time, she enjoys reading, living in Duffield, and making weird, unintelligible noises. In the future, she plans to work investigating alternative energy sources and fuel cells. You can find her running around PSB or the Engineering Quad looking lost and confused.

Peter is a Sophomore Mechanical Engineering student from Abu Dhabi, UAE (ethnically Lebanese/American). He has a wide range of professional interests that include manufacturing, design and consulting.

Other than Theta Tau, he is a member of the Mechanical subteam on the Cornell ChemE Car project team and is in charge of designing, manufacturing and assembling the chassis that the team uses, as well as troubleshooting problems that may arise during the vehicle's operation. Peter also is affiliated with Cornell Music Vs, a non-profit organization that brings students and performance groups to the elderly and young, effectively building connections through music.

In his free time, he enjoys producing music, playing the piano, traveling the world and hitting the tennis courts every so often.

Yeolim is a sophomore from Brookline, MA studying Mechanical Engineering. On campus she's a member of Cornell Baja Racing, an Outdoor Odyssey guide as well as an instructor for Cornell Outdoor Education, and an occasional member of the Big Red Marching Band. In the upcoming summer, Yeolim will be interning at Hyperloop One in LA as a part of the Electromagnetic Systems team.

Francis is a sophomore from Clifton, NJ studying Chemical Engineering with a minor in Biomedical Engineering, hoping to earn a Ph.D. and become a professor.

Last summer, Francis worked in the Alabi Lab on campus, researching drug delivery techniques. His project focuses on developing polymers to characterize nanoparticle surface proteins by detecting specific protein clusters. His group hopes to use this technique to adapt nanoparticles as targeted drug delivery vehicles, with a wide range of applications in the medical field.

Outside of research, Francis is the principal tuba player of the Cornell Symphony Orchestra and the Cornell Wind Symphony, while serving as Treasurer of the latter. He is also an Outdoor Odyssey guide, leading incoming freshmen on pre-orientation wilderness trips to help their transition to Cornell, and serving as Social Chair during the year. Francis also serves as an Engineering Peer Advisor, mentoring freshmen engineers. As a proud Filipino, he serves as Treasurer for the Cornell Filipino Association here on campus. His inner sports fan has also compelled him to serve as Intramural Chair for Theta Tau.

At the rare times Francis is not studying in Duffield, you can find him sleeping in his hammock, exploring and questioning the intricacies of the universe and society, or spending time with friends (beating Lindsey at Catan).

Kenta Takatsu is a sophomore from Westchester, NY, studying Computer Science with minor in Engineering Statistics. His professional interest is in the application of machine learning and data science.

He has worked with 2 startups where he applied deep learning for image analysis. He is continuing his career in data science and interning at Akamai Technologies next summer as a machine learning intern.

On campus, he is a member of Cornell Data Science project team and teaching a data science course as an Education Associate. Also, he is a undergraduate researcher at Social Dynamics Lab, applying sentiment analysis on Twitter dataset to study social impacts of technologies.

In his free time, he likes to dance as a member of BreakFree HipHop, watch films, and study Haiku. He secretly dreams of running a coffee shop in Hawaii after his retirement.

Kelly is a junior from Charlotte, NC studying Biomedical Engineering with a concentration in Molecular, Cellular, and Systems Engineering.

Last summer, Kelly worked in the King Lab on campus while taking online classes. Her project for the King Lab focused on formulating liposomes to target metastatic circulating tumor cells through liposome adhesion to platelets in the blood stream.

On campus, Kelly is a member of the Orientation Steering Committee, is the head of the Tech Committee for Colleges Against Cancer, and is a STEP tutor for Cornell's Pre-College Opportunity Program. Kelly enjoys woodworking, fruit snacks, and adventuring in the outdoors.

Jing Han is a sophomore from Sugar Land, TX studying Biomedical Engineering, and hoping to minor in English. Her professional interests lie in reconstructive surgery and tissue engineering.

This past summer, she worked in Donnelly Lab at Cornell studying the effects of diabetes and glucose intolerance on bone composition using Fourier Transform Infrared Spectroscopy. On campus, she is also a part of Brito Lab, where she researches the Microbiome and horizontal gene transfer, and Design Build Fly, a project team that—as the name suggests—designs, builds, and flies rad planes.

When she has free time, which she never really does, you can find her taking naps in Duffield, talking too much, or drawing, really any activity that helps her avoid her responsibilities.

Mark Flamme is a Masters in Engineering student majoring in Engineering Management from Ann Arbor, MI. He hopes to combine this degree with his Mechanical Engineering bachelors from Cornell in an engineering and business role where he helps create products and solutions for peoples’ daily problems.

Last summer he interned at a startup called SnappyScreen, which makes automated sunscreen application systems for luxury properties, where he assisted with product development and business strategy. Previous professional experiences include interning at SOLS and Advanced Design Consulting as well as conducting research in the Cornell Creative Machines Lab.

On campus, Mark is currently a teaching assistant for Entrepreneurial Management (HADM 4130). Previously, Mark was a participant in the Kessler Fellows and Engineering Leadership Certification program, teaching assistant for Foundations in Engineering Leadership, president of the AIAA, co-host of Engineers Got Talent, and philanthropy chair for his social fraternity.

During Mark’s free time he can be found running on a trail, playing an intramural sport, watching college football, and playing trivia.
Masters in Financial Engineering

Master of Engineering student in Mechanical Engineering. This past summer worked in New Product Development at Herman Miller. Previous internships include Avionics Engineering at Aerojet Rocketdyne and MEMS Reliability Engineering at Freescale Semiconductors (NXP).
